doc.title: Views: Maintain Neutral view on India; Selectively pro-cyclical in sector preference
doc.source_uri: 25.9月 普通个人版/9.1 普通个人版/GS/India Weekly Kickstart NIFTY fell 2 ww amid additional US tariffs on India 2Q GDP grew at 5-qtr high GST Council to meet_2025-08-29

passages.text: Performance: NIFTY declined 2% w/w, dragged by Real Estate and PSU banks (down 3- 4%), while FMCG led \((+1\%)\)
Valuation: MXIN fwd P/E is 22.2x (1.1 s.d. above 10y avg). Premium to MXAPJ is 49% (vs. 59% 5y avg).
Flows: FILs saw US \(0.8bn outflows wtd (- US\) 14bn ytd). DII inflows were modest at \(0.1bn wtd (+US\) 58bn ytd).
Macro: 2Q GDP grew at a 5- quarter high at 78% y/y, while additional 25% US tariffs on Indian goods, previously announced by President Trump, came into effect on Aug 27.

GST reforms: GST Council will meet on Sep 3- 4 to discuss GST reforms, including rate- rationalisation. Media reports suggest the new tax slabs could be rolled out ahead of the festive season by Sep 22. Pockets of autos, consumer ret/services, staples, cement/chemicals, eap goods, healthcare are select industries that could potentially benefit from GST rate cuts, as per our analysis.

MSCI India lagged MXAPJ for the 4th month in a row in August, underperforming by 10pp qtd. FII selling of nearly US \(55bn qtd has weighed on Indian equities, with NIFTY down 4%. Across sectors, 3Q has seen rotation into consumer- sensitives, with Consumer Discr. and Staples leading the market by 7- 8pp qtd.

Our tactical thematic ideas of GST Beneficiaries vs. Non- Beneficiaries, Consumer- Sensitive vs. Capex- sensitives, US Tare Resilient Domestics vs. Vulnerable Exporters, Earnings Recovery and Rural Growth have outperformed the market MTD.

Over the past 3 months, within active EM funds, exposure to India rose the most across markets. However, India remains among the most underweight markets within EM funds at 280bp UW allocation vs. benchmark.
India's allocation in active mutual funds globally is near a 2- decade low. Global funds across EM/Asia/Global mandates are underweight India by c.215bp on aggregate.
